column4: I've seen comments on the web that 9.10 is not as bug-free as other debian releases and that it's "a better option to wait a few months after it comes out before installing".  This does not make sense to me.  Once 9.10 comes out it's out and doesn't change until the next release, right?  Or are there point releases that fix problems along the way?

ubotto: YMMV.  If I've a bunch of administering to do I want a shell to work from.  If it's just one command then sudo's fine.  I tend to avoid it because I don't need the logs, but I can see where it'd be handy.
Ah, so I should have addressed that to trism then.  Thanks.
